intro: Psorospermum chariense, commonly known as the Cariena or African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures. Psorospermum chariense is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
